author: gstein
msg: Performance fix: when acquiring a lock for a file, just gets its
parent directory's lock. Not the entire tree. Found when doing an
'svn proplist' at the top of a working copy, and strace showed that it
* libsvn_wc/lock.c (svn_wc_adm_probe_open): if we move to the parent
directory, then the tree_lock parameter should be forced off.

author: gstein
msg: (_run_command): we want the time for the *command*, not just opening

author: gstein
msg: build/ was always intended to be a superset of ac-helpers (autoconf
macros, build tools, scripts, etc), and to obsolete the ac-helpers
directory. Get a bunch of stuff moved from ac-helpers to build.
* build/ac-macros: new directory to hold autoconf (m4) macros
* build/ac-macros/neon.m4: moved from ac-helpers. changed path to
* build/ac-macros/swig.m4: moved from ac-helpers. changed path to
* build/ac-diff-test: new directory to hold the gnu-diff test
- change paths to find_apr.m4 and find_apu.m4
- change paths in the sinclude() macros

author: gstein
msg: Turn on svn:executable for a couple scripts, so we can lose some
* autogen.sh: remove code that makes scripts executable
